de.feig.FEDM.Core

Class IHmTableGroup

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.feig.FEDM.Core.IHmTableGroup

  • public class IHmTableGroup
extends java.lang.Object
    Internal class providing Host-Mode table specific methods.
    Description:
    This class realizes the nested interface with special methods for Host-Mode table for the Reader class ReaderModule.
    Methods of this class can be called with the IHmTable member of ReaderModule.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  IHmTableGroup.HmTableItem
      Table class This table collects all data elements, when the reader works in the Host Mode.

    • Method Detail

      • setSize

        public int setSize(int newSize)
            throws FeException
        Set size of the table
        Parameters:
        newSize - Maximal numbers of records in the Host-Mode Table
        Returns:
        0, if successful
        Throws:
        FeException - exception with error code (<0)

        Description:
        The call of this method or overloaded setSize(int,int,int,int,int) is mandatory, when the Host-Mode Table should be used in the application.
        The table size should be set to the maximal number of records, received by the command [0xB0][0x01] Inventory.
        This method initializes the buffer for Transponder data to 8192 bytes, which means 256 data blocks of each 32 bytes. The content of the table will be deleted.

      • setSize

        public int setSize(int newSize,
                   int newRxDB_BlockCount,
                   int newRxDB_BlockSize,
                   int newTxDB_BlockCount,
                   int newTxDB_BlockSize)
            throws FeException
        Set size of the table with additional option to set the Transponder data buffer size
        Parameters:
        newSize - Maximal numbers of records in the Buffered Read Mode Table
        newRxDB_BlockCount - Number of data blocks for receive buffer
        newRxDB_BlockSize - Size of each data block in byte for receive buffer
        newTxDB_BlockCount - Number of data blocks for transmit buffer
        newTxDB_BlockSize - Size of each data block in byte for transmit buffer
        Returns:
        0, if successful
        Throws:
        FeException - exception with error code (<0)

        Description:
        The call of this method or overloaded setSize(int) is mandatory, when the Host-Mode Table should be used in the application.
        The table size should be set to the maximal number of records, received by the command [0xB0][0x01] Inventory.
        The content of the table will be deleted.
        This method initializes the buffers for Transponder data as follows:
        Table Member
        Description
        Buffer Size in bytes
        No. of Data Blocks
        Block Size in bytes
        rxDB
        Buffer for received public Transponder data
        newRxDB_BlockCount * newRxDB_BlockSize
        newRxDB_BlockCount
        newRxDB_BlockSize
        txDB
        Buffer for public Transponder data to be sent to
        newTxDB_BlockCount * newTxDB_BlockSize
        newTxDB_BlockCount
        newTxDB_BlockSize

      • getSize

        public int getSize()
            throws FeException
        Get size of the table
        Returns:
        Size (>= 0)
        Throws:
        FeException - exception with error code (<0)

      • getLength

        public int getLength()
              throws FeException
        Get number of valid table items
        Returns:
        Length (>0)
        Throws:
        FeException - exception with error code (<0)

        Description:
        Call this method to get the actual number of valid table items after the command [0xB0][0x01] Inventory.

      • setLength

        public int setLength(int newLength)
              throws FeException
        Set number of valid data items in the table, if the application has built the table in front of transmit actions
        Parameters:
        newLength - Number of valid table items in the Host-Mode Table
        Returns:
        0, if successful
        Throws:
        FeException - exception with error code (<0)

        Description:
        This method is normally not used.
        In rare cases, when the Host-Mode Table is built for non-addressed data transfer to the Transponder, the table can be set to 1.
        Non-addressed communication with Transponders need no Inventory and the table keeps empty.

      • reset

        public int reset()
          throws FeException
        Reset length of valid data items in the table
        Returns:
        0, if successful
        Throws:
        FeException - exception with error code (<0)

        Description:
        After call of this method, getLength() will return 0.

      • getSelectedItem

        public IHmTableGroup.HmTableItem getSelectedItem()
                                          throws FeException
        Get table item, which represents the selected Transponder
        Returns:
        Table item. See HmTableItem for more information
        Throws:
        FeException - exception with error code (<0)

        Description:
        The command [0xB0][0x25] Select switches an previously detected Transponder into the selectd state. As a Reader can manage only one Transponder in the selected state, this command can return the table item, which represents the selected Transponder.

      • getSelectedIndex

        public int getSelectedIndex()
                     throws FeException
        Return the table index of the table item, which represents the selected Transponder
        Returns:
        Table index (>=0)
        Throws:
        FeException - exception with error code (<0)

        Description:
        The command [0xB0][0x25] Select switches an previously detected Transponder into the selectd state. As a Reader can manage only one Transponder in the selected state, this command can return the table index, which represents the selected Transponder.

        public int getIndexByIDD(java.lang.String idd)

        Get the table index of the table item, identified by UID

        Returns:

        Throws:

        Description:

      • getItemByIndex

        public IHmTableGroup.HmTableItem getItemByIndex(int index)
                                         throws FeException
        Get a valid table item, identified by table index
        Parameters:
        index - Table index, beginning with 0
        Returns:
        table item. See HmTableItem for more information
        Throws:
        FeException - exception with error code (<0)

        Description:
        With this method, the table items (each contains one record from the Inventory response) can be gradually requested.
        The following example demonstrate the direct table access method.
        For more efficient and modern coding, the concept of TagHandlers should be preferred. See ITagGroup.inventory(boolean, byte, byte) for a simple example.
         

  NOTE: reader is an object of type de.feig.FEDM.Core.ReaderModule
 
  import de.feig.FEDM.Core.*;
  import de.feig.FEDM.Core.IHmTableGroup.*;
  import de.feig.FEDM.Core.ReaderCommand.*;
 
  HmTableItem item = null; // table item
 
  reader.IHmTable.reset();
  reader.ICmd.setCommandPara(ReaderCommand._0xB0.SUB_COMMAND, (byte)0x01);
  reader.ICmd.setCommandPara(ReaderCommand._0xB0.SubCmd._0x01.Req.MODE, (byte)0x00);
  int back = reader.ICmd.sendProtocol((byte)0xB0);
  if( back == 0 ||              // status: OK
      back == 0x84 ||           // status: RF warning
      back == 0x94 )            // status: more data
  {
      // internal Host-Mode Table contains now the new records

      for(int idx=0; idx<reader.IHmTable.getLength(); idx++)
      {
          item = reader.IHmTable.getItemByIndex(idx);
          if(item.isIDD)
          {
              // IDD is part of the received record
          }
      }
  }
